items.title: Kaduna Gov’t Commissions Solar-Powered Borehole at NYSC Camp to end water scarcity
items.summary: Kaduna State Government has successfully commissioned a solar-powered borehole at the NYSC Orientation Camp in Kaduna. The facility, located at the female corps members’ dormitory, was executed through the State’s Rural Water Supply and Sanitation Agency (RUWASSA). The commissioning ceremony, held at the NYSC camp, was marked by deep appreciation from the National Youth Service […]

items.title: Kaduna Targets 4.2 Million in Measles, Rubella Vaccination Campaign
items.summary: Kaduna State has launched a massive vaccination drive aimed at immunizing 4.2 million children against measles and rubella, in a bold step to protect the next generation from deadly but preventable diseases. The campaign, which began on October 18, 2025, is part of a nationwide effort and involves strong collaboration between the state government, the […]

items.title: Ikeja Electric trains electricians in safety procedures
items.summary: Ikeja Electric Plc, in partnership with the Licensed Electrical Contractors Association of Nigeria, has trained over 100 young electricians and field technicians in safety procedures, risk management, and industry standards as part of efforts to improve professionalism in the power sector. Read More

items.title: Nigeria anchors Africa’s $3bn solar push amid grid collapse
items.summary: In a sign that Nigeria may soon anchor West Africa’s energy leap, four states on Tuesday, October 14, inked solar mini-grid agreements as part of a sweeping push behind a $3 billion renewable energy fund. Read More

items.title: Nigerian Government, GenCos Finalise ₦4 Trillion Power Deal
items.summary: The Nigerian government has finalised the implementation framework for the ₦4 trillion Presidential Power Sector Debt Reduction Plan, indicating a decisive step towards restoring financial stability and investors’ confidence in Nigeria’s electricity market.

items.title: NERC: 38 Nigerians Killed, 19 Injured in 60 Electricity-related Incidents in Q2 2025
items.summary: Nigeria recorded a sharp rise in power-sector accidents in the second quarter of 2025, reporting 60 separate incidents, which resulted in 38 fatalities and 19 injuries, according to the latest data released by the Nigerian Electricity Regulatory Commission (NERC). Read More

items.title: Eko DisCo registers electricity company as Lagos subsidiary
items.summary: Eko Electricity Distribution Company Plc (EKEDC) has formally registered Excel Electricity Distribution Company Limited as a wholly owned subsidiary to oversee its electricity distribution operations within Lagos State. Read More

items.title: NSE: With 55% Grid Access, Nigeria Faces Persistent Energy Challenges
items.summary: Despite Nigeria’s installed capacity of 13,014 MW serving over 220 million people, only 55 per cent of Nigerians has grid access, highlighting persistent energy challenges in the country, the Nigerian Society of Engineers (NSE) has said. Read More

items.title: BREAKING: Nigerian Authorities Delist 1.9 Million Electricity Customers For Inactivity In One Year
items.summary: A Sahara Reporters review of data from the Nigerian Electricity Regulatory Commission (NERC) has revealed that 1.9 million customers were delisted from the Commission’s database between March and June 2025. Read More

items.title: Spike in electricity demand pushes subsidy to N514b in three months
items.summary: Nigeria’s electricity market continues to be weighed down by subsidy payments and inefficiencies as taxpayers incurred N514.35 billion to subsidise electricity consumption in just three months, largely driven by high demand from residents of Lagos and Abuja. Read More

items.title: FG to add 7,000MW to national grid –Power minister
items.summary: The Minister of Power, Chief Adebayo Adelabu, has announced that the Federal Government is moving into the first phase of the Siemens power project, which will add an additional 7,000 megawatts to the national grid and help stabilise electricity supply across the country. Read More
